input.name: __VIEWSTATE

p.span: for the latest COVID-19 related information.

strong.span: GRADING REMOTE LEARNING ASSIGNMENTS AND FOURTH QUARTER GRADES

span.style: background-color: #ffffff; color: #181818; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; font-weight: 700

span.p: The following are links to each school buildings Remote Learning Assignments for the month of April. These will be due upon our scheduled return to school on May 4th. The paper assignments turned in recently will be picked up by staff members in a few days. It is recommended that we leave the papers still for a period of time to make sure they are safe to touch. Once the assignments are graded, they will be reported into ProgressBook. We ask for your patience over the next few weeks. The assignments can be found on the links below.

a.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; background-color: transparent; cursor: pointer; color: #24579a

span.p: We will continue to provide breakfast and lunches on Wednesday’s throughout the closure. The weekly pickup is between 6:00-7:00 p.m. at the Jr/Sr High School ONLY. Please drive to the rear of the building along the curb and stop near the courtyard with the steps leading to the second floor. Remain in your vehicle to limit exposure and we will bring the items to you.

p.style: color: #181818; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; background-color: #ffffff; margin-right: 0.5in
color: #181818; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; background-color: #ffffff; margin-right: 0.5in

span.p: As per legislation passed by the Ohio House and Senate and signed by the Governor, there will be no testing for the spring.

p.style: color: #181818; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; background-color: #ffffff; margin-right: 0.5in; text-align: justify

p.span: Our mental health professionals are reaching out to families to ensure they have open lines of communication during the closure and to make alternative plans if necessary. Our mental health counselors will be monitoring emails and reaching out to our school families in need. Teletherapy and in-person sessions will be an option for meeting with your school-based therapist. To reach your school mental health provider, you can email the provider directly through www.gebhartcounseling.org website. Find your provider on the “Our Team” page and click on her name to email directly. You can also call Gebhart Counseling at (937) 456-2805 to leave your provider a message. If a student or parent is in crisis, you can reach out to the following local hotlines for assistance: Preble County Crisis Hotline (866) 532-3097 or Crisis Textline #4HOPE to 741741
All spring sports will begin when we return. There will be an acclimation period priod to the season starting on May 9th.

Preble Shawnee High School Commencement Ceremony is set for Friday, May 22nd. If we are unable to hold the ceremony on that date due to the continued closure of schools by Governor DeWine, we will secure another date in June. Rest assured, the ceremony will be at the Princeton Pike Church of God, as normal. The church is working with each school to secure new dates. We have also been in communication with the Mariott in Hamilton. They are committed to working with us on rescheduling a date. We will communicate both graduation and prom, as well as any other rescheduled events as soon as we can. We are committed to delivering a great experience for our students and our seniors.

Any senior who needs to pass their second semeter classes to qualify for graduation needs to satisfactorily complete the Remote Learning Assignments. Those students who were "at-risk" prior to the closure have been communicated with by the administration and counselors.

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff

div.style: color: #181818; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; background-color: #ffffff; text-align: center

span.div: Click here for the policy

span.a: State of Ohio Immunization Summary for School Attendance

a.title: State of Ohio Immunization Summary for Preschool

div.a: State of Ohio Immunization Summary for Preschool
7th Grade Immunization Reminder: Tdap and Meningitis Vaccination

a.title: Guidelines for Students Receiving Medication at School

div.a: Guidelines for Students Receiving Medication at School

span.div: Ohio law gives students permission to self-carry asthma inhalers, epinephrine auto-injectors, and diabetes supplies and medications while at school. Parents/ guardians must submit a written request thru the school office and are required to complete the standard medication permission forms. A physician's signature authorizing self-care determination is also required.
Beginning in October, Vision and Hearing Screening will be completed for students in Preschool, Kindergarten, First, Third, Fifth, Seventh (vision only), Ninth, and Eleventh (hearing only) grades.
Referral letters will be mailed to parents of any student who appears to need additional follow-up.
Please contact your child's school office if you have questions or concerns about your child's vision and/ or hearing needs. Or you may email: Lori Cottingim, cottingiml@psarrows.com
; Erica Million, millione@psarrows.com; Katy Smith, smithk@psarrows.com.

Food Substitutions prescribed by a licensed healthcare provider are made when, in the licensed healthcare providers assessment, food allergies may result in severe, life-threatening reactions. The child's condition would meet the definition of "disability". Other food intolerances are noted and school staff will assist the child to abide the restriction as possible. Due to the large number of students eating breakfast and lunch, the limited number of personnel, and the short time frame allowed for meals, school staff cannot strictly monitor for every diet request. For parents who wish to ensure that non-life threatening dietary restrictions are always followed, it is best for the parent/ guardian to provide all food.

The Mobile Dentist provides dental care to our students at Camden Primary and West Elkton Intermediate. Permission forms will be sent home a week or two before the scheduled visit. For more information about dental care for students at school, click Mobile here.
Parent awareness and continued head checks at home are the best way to address the spread of head lice in schools. Please check your child(ren) at least weekly throughout the school year.

As always, remind your child against sharing personal items such as combs, brushes, hats, scarves, etc. You may also consider placing coats, hats, scarves, and backpacks in the dryer each day. Thirty minutes on high heat will kill any live bugs.

If you suspect your child may have head lice, please contact the school office. Your child may be checked and other parents in the classroom alerted that their child may have been exposed to head lice. Also, if your child has head lice and has recently had friends sleep over in your home or your child has gone to other homes for a sleep over, please notify parents so that they are alerted to check their child. It is a small courtesy that would go a long way towards alleviating the problem for others.

a.title: Letter to Parents about Head Lice

div.a: Letter to Families about Head Lice

a.title: National Association of School Nurses Position Statement on Head Lice

div.a: National Association of School Nurses Position Statement on Head Lice

a.title: American Academy of Pediatrics Statement Regarding Head Lice

div.a: American Academy of Pediatrics Statement Regarding Head Lice

span.div: Occasionally bed bugs are found at school. Actual bed bug infestations in school classrooms are uncommon. More commonly, a few bed bugs will hitchhike to school from an infested home by hiding in a student's clothing or backpack. Bed bugs that hitch a ride into school in one student's belongings could be carried home by another student.
Consider daily inspection of backpacks, lunchboxes, coats and other items that travel back and forth to school.
Store students' items that travel back and forth to school sealed in plastic containers to prevent potential travel of bed bugs to your home.
Clothes and coats suspected of being in contact with bed bugs may be dried at the highest dryer heat setting for an additional 30 minutes after the item is dry to kill bed bugs.
Remember: Bed bugs are not a sign of bad housekeeping or uncleanliness.

a.title: Letter to Families Regarding Bed Bugs

div.a: Letter to Families Regarding Bed Bugs
